attributes.action: Introduce the death penalty for anyone who lights a bonfire in the village of Lydlinch, Dorset over a weekend during fine weather.
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background:
Due to the deteriorating social structure in the UK,many people have become disrespecful of certain basic, citizen rights. The right to enjoy a sunny day (when it arrives !)in ones own garden, undisturbed by the actions of neighbours in relative peace & quiet is, we believe, a basic right.
The actions of some people involving the constant burning of rubbish & material can be very disturbing, particularly due to the amount of smoke generated by such bonfires.
As these people have a general disregard for anyone other than themselves, we believe that the only deterent is to introduce a penalty that is sufficiently harsh to act as a deterent. 
Such crimes we believe, should therefore be punishable by death by public hanging.
The village of Lydlinch once had a public gallows sited next to the road, to act as a deterent to villains. We would like to see this ressurected to stop once and for all, the practice of lighting unnecessary bonfires.

reasons: Intended to be humorous, or has no point about government policy
